title: Can an evangelical convert to Satanism? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yet another “Can X convert to Satanism” type question. They all have the same answer, regardless of what X is: Yes. If the person wants to convert there is nothing to stop them from doing so. Converting from a religion requires losing faith in that religions teachings/beliefs, and converting to a religion generally entails at least a certain amount of knowledge of what that religion’s central teachings/beliefs are and subscribing to them, which for most branches of Satanism really just involves a lot of reading and learning about what Satanism actually is, because there’s no formal requirement for membership past the person’s own will. More directly though, one of my partners is an ex-Evangelical who has read my collection of books and answers here on Quora about Satanism and freely admits he really knew nothing about real Satanism and it sounds more reasonable to him than what he was believing.

Don’t know what a evangelical is…. Do you mean a Christian? Sure.. you can accept Satan as your God. but you never knew Jesus to begin with… maybe you were an evangelical… And the testimony is this, that God has given us eternal life, and this life is in His Son. He who has the Son has the life; he who does not have the Son of God does not have the life.— 1 John 5:11-12

Sure, anyone can convert from any religion to any other religion. When a person changes his or her beliefs, he can then convert to the religion matching his or her new beliefs. So conversion to some form of Satanism have not been rare.
One could make a case that many white Evangelicals are already doing the work of Satan and not following the teachings of Christ.
Anyone can convert to anything, the question is, why would an evangelical want to convert to Satanism ? 🤔
